definition: feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)

sentences.english: Only by being open and inclusive can a country prosper and can our continent prosper.
sentences.chinese: 只有開放兼容，國家才能富強，亞歐大陸才能興旺。

sentences.english: Respectfully requests, and praying fathers come to enjoy the family size peace, prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 恭請祖宗降臨享用，並祈保合家大小平安，興旺發達。

sentences.english: Prosperity is descovers vices and adversity virtues.
sentences.chinese: 興旺時現邪惡，艱難時顯美德。

sentences.english: The 16th Party Congress fully demonstrates that our Party is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 黨的十六大充分表明我們黨興旺發達，後繼有人。

sentences.english: They’re a sign of hope that Monrovia may once again be bustling and prosperous.
sentences.chinese: 它們是蒙羅維亞再次繁榮興旺的希望之光。

sentences.english: And the prices will rise equated with the economic boom is worthy of attention.
sentences.chinese: 而將房價的升高等同於經濟的興旺，是值得警惕的。

sentences.english: As China boomed, the ranks of the middle class swelled.
sentences.chinese: 中國經濟興旺的時候，中產階級膨脹。

sentences.english: What’s kept them prideful and strong all these generations?
sentences.chinese: 他們憑什麼世世代代保持了自己的尊嚴和興旺呢？

sentences.english: 24But the word of God continued to increase and spread.
sentences.chinese: 神的道日見興旺，越發廣傳。

sentences.english: A prosperous and stable population is an asset in every country.
sentences.chinese: 興旺和穩定的人口對每個國家來講，都是一種財富。

sentences.english: A business cannot thrive without good management.
sentences.chinese: 企業沒有良好的管理不會興旺。

sentences.english: Likewise, a human marriage influenced by wealth often results in offspring.
sentences.chinese: 同樣地，財力雄厚的人類婚姻往往也能使得人丁興旺。

sentences.english: The 17th Party Congress fully demonstrates that our Party is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 黨的十七大充分表明我們黨興旺發達，後繼有人。

sentences.english: The business would not thrive without good mangement.
sentences.chinese: 沒有良好的經營管理，事業就不會興旺發達。

sentences.english: Because of your partnership in the gospel from the first day until now.
sentences.chinese: 因爲頭一天直到如今，你們是同心合意的興旺福音。

sentences.english: The 12th Party congress fully demonstrates that our Party is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 黨的十二大充分表明我們黨興旺發達，後繼有人。

definition: to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
